title: The New Cost of Trump’s Bill, and Gen Z’s Retirement Plan
summary: Plus, the tricky science behind lime green Jell-O.

title: Trump Vowed to Dismantle MS-13. His Deal With Bukele Threatens That Effort.
summary: Top gang leaders being sent back to El Salvador were part of a lengthy federal investigation that has amassed evidence of a corrupt pact between the Bukele government and MS-13.

title: Why Is Trump Returning MS-13 Leaders to El Salvador? Takeaways From Times Reporting.
summary: The agreement with Nayib Bukele, the president of El Salvador, is undermining a long-running federal investigation into the gang, according to people familiar with the inquiry.

title: Canada to Scrap Tax That Led Trump to Suspend Trade Talks
summary: The government said on Sunday night that it would cancel its tax on American technology companies, handing a victory to the Trump administration.

title: Trump Wants America to Make iPhones. Here’s How India Is Doing It.
summary: India is carving out a new space for Foxconn and other high-end manufacturers, just as President Trump demands American companies do at home.

title: How Tariffs Are Affecting Wedding Dress Prices
summary: Jordyn Holman, a New York Times business reporter, is planning a wedding. To find out how tariffs are affecting the bridal industry, she visited three different dress shops selling gowns from around the world.

title: Trump’s Tariffs May Push This American Company to Move Jobs to China
summary: The experience of a company in the textile business illustrates how the trade war could force some industries to shift production out of the United States.

title: As Trade Deadline Nears, Europe Preps for a Scant Outline of a Deal
summary: President Trump’s administration once promised 90 deals in 90 days. When it comes to the European Union, it may be more of a framework.

title: 2 Firefighters Killed in Idaho Sniper Ambush
summary: Firefighters were responding to a blaze in the panhandle of Idaho when the shooting happened, a sheriff said. The body of a suspect was recovered on Sunday evening.

title: What We Know About the Idaho Shooting
summary: The authorities said a gunman started a wildfire to lure firefighters, then ambushed them in a sniper attack.

title: Trump’s Immigration Crackdown in L.A. Upends Everyday Life for Latinos
summary: Anxiety over federal immigration detentions has gripped thousands of residents in the area and led many to limit the time they spend in public.

title: The Summer Job, a Rite of Passage for Teens, May Be Fading Away
summary: As businesses face economic uncertainty, seasonal work is harder to find, pushing the unemployment rate for teenagers above 13 percent.

title: How Do You Teach Computer Science in the A.I. Era?
summary: Universities across the country are scrambling to understand the implications of generative A.I.’s transformation of technology.

title: Are You Applying for Tech Jobs or Tech Internships? We Want to Hear About It.
summary: Companies using A.I. tools to automate tasks like coding are changing job prospects for recent grads and college students. Tell us about your experiences.

title: Drifting From the West’s Orbit, Russians Find a New Role Model in China
summary: China has become trendy for Russians who once worshiped everything Western. Young people are learning Mandarin, and Chinese culture and goods have become ubiquitous in Moscow.

title: Taiwan’s President Takes on China, and His Opponents, in Speaking Tour
summary: Lai Ching-te is ramping up his warnings about China’s threat to Taiwan. Critics say he is stoking divisions, and risking blowback from Beijing.

title: A Year After ‘Loveless Landslide,’ U.K. Leader Is Even Less Popular
summary: With scores of Labour Party lawmakers in open revolt and voters signaling their distaste, some are urging Prime Minister Keir Starmer to abandon caution and pivot left.

title: Starmer and Glastonbury Condemn Bob Vylan’s Chant Against Israel’s Military
summary: The band Bob Vylan led a crowd in a chant of “Death, death to the I.D.F.” while performing at Glastonbury, Britain’s biggest music festival.

title: What the University of Virginia Should Have Done
summary: The university should have stood up to the Justice Department.

title: Corporate Politics
summary: We take a look at why businesses are turning away from political causes.

title: At the Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs Trial, Jurors Are Ready to Deliberate
summary: The panel of 12 will be asked to decide whether the music mogul is guilty of racketeering conspiracy and sex trafficking.

title: 2 Shot Near Stonewall Inn After New York City’s Pride March
summary: One of the victims was in critical condition after being shot in the head. Mayor Eric Adams said the shooting occurred as Pride celebrations were ending.

title: From Iran-Israel Strikes to Russia’s War: How Conflicts Reshape Air Travel
summary: Whether caused by a long war or brief skirmish, the closing of skies to air travel is having big effects on cost, convenience and safety.

title: They Demanded Democracy. Years Later, They Are Still Paying the Price.
summary: Thousands of young people lost careers, friends and dreams after taking part in mass antigovernment protests that erupted six years ago in Hong Kong.
